definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: Large-caliber naval guns have played a significant part in combined operations of navyand army in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 大口径舰炮在海陆军联合作战体系中有着重要的地位。

sentences.english: The coats of the admirals and generals were covered with gold braid.
sentences.chinese: 海陆军的将军们上衣上都饰有金色穗带。

definition: north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
Allies/entente (i.e. Western powers allied to China in WW1)
north China navy (esp. the ill-fated Chinese navy in the 1895 war with Japan)
the Qing Dynasty name for the coastal provinces of Liaoning, Hebei, and Shandong
